title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Double Taxation Relief (Taxes on
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Double Taxation Relief (Taxes on 

Income) (Guernsey) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited double taxation relief (taxes income) (guernsey) order 2022

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: It is declared—
text_raw:
2. 

It is declared— 

(a) 

that the arrangements specified in the Protocol, the text of which 
is set out in the Schedule, have been made with the States of 
Guernsey in relation to matters relating to affording relief from 
double taxation considered appropriate by the Government, and 

(b) 

that it is expedient that those arrangements should have the force 
of law. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 7th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [490] 3

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: PROTOCOL BETWEEN IRELAND AND THE STATES OF GUERNSEY
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

PROTOCOL BETWEEN IRELAND AND THE STATES OF GUERNSEY 
AMENDING THE AGREEMENT OF 26 MARCH 2009 FOR AFFORDING 
RELIEF FROM DOUBLE TAXATION WITH RESPECT TO CERTAIN 
INCOME OF INDIVIDUALS AND ESTABLISHING A MUTUAL 
AGREEMENT PROCEDURE IN CONNECTION WITH THE 
ADJUSTMENT OF PROFITS OF ASSOCIATED ENTERPRISES 

The Government of Ireland and the States of Guernsey; 

Desiring to conclude a Protocol to amend the Agreement between Ireland 
and the States of Guernsey for Affording relief from Double Taxation with respect 
to Certain Income of Individuals and Establishing a Mutual Agreement procedure in 
Connection with the Adjustment of Profits of Associated Enterprises signed on 26 
March 2009; 

Have agreed as follows: 

ARTICLE I 

The Preamble to the Agreement shall be deleted and replaced by the following 
Preamble: 

“The Government of Ireland and the States of Guernsey, recognising that the two 
Parties have concluded an Agreement for the Exchange of Information Relating to 
Tax Matters; 

Desiring to conclude an Agreement for affording relief from double taxation with 
respect to certain income of individuals and establishing a mutual agreement 
procedure in connection with the adjustment of profits of associated enterprises; 

Intending to eliminate double taxation with respect to the taxes covered by this 
agreement without creating opportunities for non-taxation or reduced taxation 
through tax evasion or avoidance (including through treaty-shopping arrangements 
aimed at obtaining reliefs provided in this agreement for the indirect benefit of 
residents of third jurisdictions), 

Have agreed as follows:”. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [490] 

ARTICLE II 

Paragraph 1 of Article 9 (Mutual agreement procedure) of the Agreement shall be 
deleted and replaced by the following: 

“1. Where a person considers that the actions of one or both of the 
Parties result or will result for him in taxation not in accordance with the provisions 
of this Agreement, he may, irrespective of the remedies provided by the domestic 
law of those Parties, present his case to the competent authority of either Party. The 
case must be presented within three years from the first notification of the action 
resulting in taxation not in accordance with the provisions of the Agreement.”. 

ARTICLE III 

The following new Article 9A (Entitlement to benefits) shall be inserted after 
Article 9 (Mutual agreement procedure) of the Agreement as follows: 

“ARTICLE 9A 

Entitlement to benefits

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: 1. Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Agreement, a benefit
text_raw:
1. Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Agreement, a benefit 
under this Agreement shall not be granted in respect of an item of 
income if it is reasonable to conclude, having regard to all relevant facts 
and circumstances, that obtaining that benefit was one of the principal 
purposes of any arrangement or transaction that resulted directly or 
indirectly in that benefit, unless it is established that granting that benefit 
in these circumstances would be in accordance with the object and 
purpose of the relevant provisions of this Agreement.
text_norm: 1 notwithstanding provision agreement benefit agreement shall granted respect item income reasonable conclude regard relevant fact circumstance obtaining benefit one principal purpose arrangement transaction resulted directly indirectly benefit unless established granting benefit circumstance would accordance object purpose relevant provision agreement

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: 2. Where a benefit under this Agreement is denied to a person under
text_raw:
2. Where a benefit under this Agreement is denied to a person under 
paragraph 1, the competent authority of the Party that would otherwise 
have granted this benefit shall nevertheless treat that person as being 
entitled to this benefit, or to different benefits with respect to a specific 
item of income if such competent authority, upon request from that 
person and after consideration of the relevant facts and circumstances, 
determines that such benefits would have been granted to that person in 
the absence of the transaction or arrangement referred to in paragraph 1. 
The competent authority of the Party to which the request has been made 
will consult with the competent authority of the other Party before 
rejecting a request made under this paragraph by a resident of that other 
Party.”. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [490] 5 

ARTICLE IV
text_norm: 2 benefit agreement denied person paragraph 1 competent authority party would otherwise granted benefit shall nevertheless treat person entitled benefit different benefit respect specific item income competent authority upon request person consideration relevant fact circumstance determines benefit would granted person absence transaction arrangement referred paragraph 1 competent authority party request made consult competent authority party rejecting request made paragraph resident party  490 5 article iv

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: 1. Each of the Parties shall notify to the other in writing the completion of the
text_raw:
1. Each of the Parties shall notify to the other in writing the completion of the 
procedures required by its law for the bringing into force of this Protocol.
text_norm: 1 party shall notify writing completion procedure required law bringing force protocol

title: 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) that where the Government by order declare that the
heading: 2. This Protocol shall enter into force on the date of the later of these notifications,
text_raw:
2. This Protocol shall enter into force on the date of the later of these notifications, 
and its provisions shall have effect for tax years beginning on or after the first day of 
January in the calendar year following the year of the entry into force of this 
Protocol. 

In witness whereof the undersigned, duly authorised thereto, have signed this 
Protocol. 

Done in duplicate at London this 8th day of December 2021, and at London this 
8th day of December 2021. 

For the Government of Ireland: 

For the States of Guernsey 

Adrian O’Neill 

Jonathan Le Tocq 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

4 October, 2022. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [490]
